content: Heechul Yun Heechul Yun (윤희철) office1 (ITTC): 134 Nichols Hall, 2335 Irving hill Rd, Lawrence, KS, 66045 office2 (Eaton): 3040 Eaton Hall, 1520 West 15th St, Lawrence, KS, 66045 e-mail: heechul.yun (at) ku.edu tel: 785-864-7735 Home | Publications | Courses | Projects | People | Software About I am a Deane E. Ackers Scholar and Professor in the department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at the University of Kansas. I earned my Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in 2013. Prior to the PhD, I worked for Samsung Electronics and ETRI. I enjoy reading and running. [CV] [Bio] Research My research goal is to build safe and secure real-time computing system infrastructure (OS, architecture, and middleware) for intelligent cyber-physical systems. Please check the overview of my recent research. Also, check the Projects tab for more details of my current/past research projects. According to CSRankings, which uses a publication quality based metric, KU is ranked 14th in the US in the embedded & real-time systems area due to my publications. I am looking for motivated students who are interested in embedded systems research. Experiences in AI, OS, architecture, and robotics are a plus. Currently available positions include (but not limited to): PhD/MS in real-time edge AI (see this ) PhD/MS in microarchitectural attcks and defenses (see this and this ) PhD/MS in time predictable high-performance heterogeneous computing platforms. (see this ) Undergraduate research assistant (URA) in autonomous car, UAV testbeds (see this) Feel free to email me if you are interested in any of the related areas.
